definitions.definition: An interval of a major second .
The character of a sound , especially the timbre of an instrument or voice .
The pitch of a word 's sound that distinguishes a difference in meaning , as for example in Chinese .
A whining style of speaking; a kind of mournful or artificial strain of voice; an affected speaking with a measured rhythm and a regular rise and fall of the voice.
examples: Children often read with a tone .

definitions.definition: The manner in which speech or writing is expressed , especially the aspects of diction (word choice), connotation , emotiveness , and register .
The shade or quality of a colour .
The favourable effect of a picture produced by the combination of light and shade, or of colours.
The definition and firmness of a muscle or organ ; see also: tonus .
The state of a living body or of any of its organs or parts in which the functions are healthy and performed with due vigor.
Normal tension or responsiveness to stimuli.

subdefinitions.definition: The general character , atmosphere , mood , or vibe (of a situation, place, etc.).
examples: Her rousing speech gave an upbeat tone to the rest of the evening.

subdefinitions.definition: The quality of being respectable or admirable .
subdefinitions.label_groups: Chiefly in the form lower/raise the tone of something

secondary_definitions: ( music ) ( in the diatonic scale ) An interval of a major second .
( music ) ( in a Gregorian chant ) A recitational melody .
The character of a sound , especially the timbre of an instrument or voice .
( language , linguistics ) The pitch of a word 's sound that distinguishes a difference in meaning , as for example in Chinese .
( language , dated ) A whining style of speaking; a kind of mournful or artificial strain of voice; an affected speaking with a measured rhythm and a regular rise and fall of the voice.
( language , literature ) The manner in which speech or writing is expressed , especially the aspects of diction (word choice), connotation , emotiveness , and register .
( obsolete ) State of mind; temper; mood.
The shade or quality of a colour .
( painting ) The favourable effect of a picture produced by the combination of light and shade, or of colours.
The definition and firmness of a muscle or organ ; see also: tonus .
( biology ) The state of a living body or of any of its organs or parts in which the functions are healthy and performed with due vigor.
( biology ) Normal tension or responsiveness to stimuli.
